verses.kjv: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.
verses.ct: So brothers and sisters, because of God's mercy, I urge you to offer your bodies as living sacrifices — set apart and pleasing to God. This is the genuine way to worship him.

verses.kjv: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
verses.ct: Don't let the patterns of this world shape you. Instead, let God completely change you by transforming the way you think, so that you can recognize what God's will is — what is good, pleasing, and perfect.

verses.kjv: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.
verses.ct: Because of the grace given to me, I'm telling each one of you: don't have a higher opinion of yourself than you should. Instead, evaluate yourself honestly, based on the measure of faith that God has given you.

verses.kjv: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:
verses.ct: Think of it this way: our physical body has many parts, and each part serves a different function.

verses.kjv: So we, being many, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.
verses.ct: In the same way, though there are many of us, we form one body in Christ, and we each belong to one another.

verses.kjv: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;
verses.ct: We each have different gifts based on the grace given to us. If your gift is prophecy, use it in proportion to your faith.

verses.kjv: Or ministry, let us wait on our ministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;
verses.ct: If your gift is serving, focus on serving. If it's teaching, devote yourself to teaching.

verses.kjv: Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth, let him do it with simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.
verses.ct: If it's encouraging others, give yourself to encouragement. If you give to those in need, do it generously. If you lead, lead with dedication. If you show mercy, do it with joy.

verses.kjv: Let love be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.
verses.ct: Your love must be genuine. Hate what is evil and hold tightly to what is good.

verses.kjv: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;
verses.ct: Be devoted to each other with the warmth of family love. Outdo one another in showing respect.

verses.kjv: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
verses.ct: Never be lazy in your efforts. Stay passionate in spirit. Serve the Lord.

verses.kjv: Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;
verses.ct: Let hope fill you with joy. Stand firm through hardship. Stay committed to prayer.

verses.kjv: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.
verses.ct: Share what you have with God's people who are in need. Practice hospitality eagerly.

verses.kjv: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.
verses.ct: Ask God to bless those who persecute you — bless them, and never curse them.

verses.kjv: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.
verses.ct: Celebrate with those who are celebrating, and grieve with those who are grieving.

verses.kjv: Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.
verses.ct: Treat each other as equals. Don't pursue status or prestige — instead, associate with people who are overlooked. Don't consider yourselves superior.

verses.kjv: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.
verses.ct: Never repay anyone's wrong with another wrong. Make it your aim to do what everyone can see is right.

verses.kjv: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.
verses.ct: As far as it depends on you, do everything you can to live at peace with everyone.

verses.kjv: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
verses.ct: Dear friends, never take revenge yourselves. Instead, leave room for God's justice, because Scripture says, 'Vengeance belongs to me; I will settle the score,' says the Lord.

verses.kjv: Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.
verses.ct: Instead, if your enemy is hungry, give them food. If they're thirsty, give them something to drink. By doing this, you will heap burning coals of shame on their head.

verses.kjv: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
verses.ct: Don't let evil defeat you. Instead, defeat evil by doing good.
